LEGERNote by the Secretary of the CabinetBy direction of the Prime Minister, I circulate, for the information of theCabinet, the letter below from the Senior Steward of the Jockey Club on the cabinet's decision concerning the St. Leger (C. (55) 22nd Conclusions, Minute 4).(Signed) NORMAN BROOK.Cabinet Office, S.W. 1,29ih March, 1955.My dear Sir Winston, 21st March, 1955.During my absence in the Middle East, Bernard Norfolk acknowledged your letter regarding the day of the week on which the St. Leger should be run.The Stewards of the Jockey Club, and myself in particular, are most grateful to you and the Cabinet for your help in this matter. It is a great relief to have got the Flat Racing Fixture List back to normal.If the Wednesday results in an additional loss of coal production, the Stewardswould agree that it would be right to revert to a Saturday fixture.Yours sincerely,R. G. FEILDEN.The Right Hon. Sir Winston Churchill, K.G., O.M., C.H.47851Printed for the Cabinet. March 1955CONFIDENTIAL Copy No. g gC. (55) 9030 th March, 1955
